meanings.definition: Give the right to vote to
meanings.sent1: The new law will enfranchise many citizens who were previously unable to vote.
meanings.sent2: In a democracy, it is important to enfranchise all eligible voters.
meanings.sent3: The magical genie decided to enfranchise all the animals in the forest, allowing them to vote for their favorite tree.
meanings.sent4: The power of education can enfranchise individuals, giving them a voice in society.
meanings.sent5: Enfranchising the youth is crucial for the future of our nation.

meanings.definition: Endow with the rights of citizenship, especially the right to vote
meanings.sent1: The new law will enfranchise many immigrants, granting them the full rights of citizens.
meanings.sent2: Being enfranchised means having a say in the decisions that affect your community.
meanings.sent3: The wizard's spell accidentally enfranchised all the household objects, leading to a chaotic voting process.
meanings.sent4: Music has the power to enfranchise the soul, allowing it to express emotions freely.
meanings.sent5: Enfranchising individuals with disabilities promotes inclusivity and equality in society.
